Memo:
Licorice root is an excellent tonic and one of the most basic tools of any herbalist. Chinese Licorice root was called the "Great Detoxifier".

Note: Licorice root has been known to reduce potassium levels leading to possible heart problems.

Alfalfa (leaves and flowers) are listed as a general tonic and may support healing for the whole system.
Alfalfa contains many vitamins, minerals, enzymes and trace minerals.

Warning: In a higher dosage, Alfalfa seeds may be toxic.
General tonic. Has been used as a substitute for black tea.
Taheebo is a good tonic but is also listed for its cancer and virus fighting abilities.

Cocklebur is a tonic, calms the nerves, and in use for urinary problems and malaria.
It is also said to be effective for certain cancers.
Curled or Yellow dock has similar tonic properties.

Early settlers used Turtlehead for rejuvenation. On the chosen day they would take only a spoonful of the herb's fresh juice and then they would observe a strict diet for up to four days.
Turtlehead is a general tonic used for debility, indigestion, constipation, piles and worms.

Angelica is a good tonic. Chinese Angelica (Dong Quai) is one of the main tonics for women.

Note: Angelica is known to increase the blood's sugar level. It should not be taken by diabetics, nor by pregnant women.
Anise contains essential vitamins, minerals and estrogen. It is known to stimulate all glands and organs in the body.
Contains many, if not all, important nutrients.
Black Cohosh has a stimulating effect on the whole body and is especially useful for balancing female hormones.
The nuts are very nutritious, containing iodine, many minerals, the oxygen supplying vitamin B15, and a high level of Omega 3 fatty acids.
Blessed Thistle improves circulation and is a general tonic for all organs including the brain.

Blue Vervain is a tonic for the lungs, intestines and the nerves.
It contains some Vit. E and C; also Calcium and Manganese.
Borage is called the 'Herb of Gladness.' It is a general tonic for the heart, the lungs, the nerves, the mucous membranes, the glands and the intestines.

Called the "Indian Ginseng." Used to strengthen body and mind.
All docks seem to be good
for the liver (as most of the bitter tasting plants are) and for the blood.
Centaury is a general tonic for the whole body.
Damiana has been used as an aphrodisiac. But, its tonic effects concern the whole body and the leaves and roots are good for exhaustion.

False Unicorn is known for its tonic properties. It soothes the intestinal membranes and is good for all digestive problems.
It is also listed as a tonic for the kidneys, the prostate and the uterus.

Irish Moss is an excellent Tonic with immune enhancing properties.
Irish Moss is a seaweed, and like other seaweeds, it contains Iodine, many vitamins and minerals.
